body_html:
I have also met this issue. But there is indeed a libstdc++.so.6 shared library under /usr/lib64. I have to use the libstdc++ under Anaconda path. My LD_LIBRARY_PATH before adding Anaconda lib path is:

/home/haojiedong/local/lib:/usr/lib64/::/usr/local/cuda-9.0/lib64/
body_text:
I have also met this issue. But there is indeed a libstdc++.so.6 shared library under /usr/lib64. I have to use the libstdc++ under Anaconda path. My LD_LIBRARY_PATH before adding Anaconda lib path is:
/home/haojiedong/local/lib:/usr/lib64/::/usr/local/cuda-9.0/lib64/
body:
I have also met this issue. But there is indeed a `libstdc++.so.6` shared library under `/usr/lib64`. I have to use the `libstdc++` under Anaconda path. My `LD_LIBRARY_PATH` before adding Anaconda lib path is:

```
/home/haojiedong/local/lib:/usr/lib64/::/usr/local/cuda-9.0/lib64/
```
